metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17025 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 71. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 72.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17025` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
